channel.title: No-Ip isn't working! HELP!
channel.description: k so I got myself a no-ip with port 80 redirect using my IP named it and then made it a host, I have the duc and it says my host is online but the only way i can connect is by using local host 127.0.0.1 if i type my no-ip it doesnt work, I have a router but it isn't connected when i use my server does that affect something? should i try to connect my router and then do port forwarding again? I don't know help me!

item.title: No-Ip isn't working! HELP!
item.dc:creator: @jungledude jungledude
item.description:
@jungledude wrote:

Steviie:

Yes, but as I said, to have a no-ip you MUST portforward, so basically you need to use your router.

I didn’t have to… Lol.

Psp, when you do portforward you will have to use 127.0.0.1 or localhost as your ip. Only ppl from other computers can use your no-ip ip.

Read full topic

item.title: No-Ip isn't working! HELP!
item.dc:creator: @Steviie Steviie
item.description:
@Steviie wrote:

If you want a No-IP IP address, you HAVE TO PortForward.

As you make your No-IP address you must have DUC open and you must have your runserver open and running.

Once you’ve made your No-IP address with those programs open, you now must then PortForward for you to use your No-IP!

NOTE - YOU MUST HAVE YOUR RUNSERVER.BAT AND DUC OPEN WHEN YOU MAKE YOUR NO-IP AND ALSO WHEN YOU PORTFORWARD !!

Read full topic

item.title: No-Ip isn't working! HELP!
item.dc:creator: @darkandlightjak5 darkandlightjak5
item.description:
@darkandlightjak5 wrote:

when you download and install the DUC, and RUN it, there should be a screen with your IP, that you chose. There should be a box next to it. Click the box so it turns into a smiley face.
